title: StatefulSet never ready on no-op deployment with partitions.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

body:
Hi,

We're running into an issue where our StatefulSets are never considered ready when using `partition` in the `updateStrategy.rollingUpdate`.

The scenario is as follows:

* A StatefulSet with 3 replicas is set to `partition: 3`.
* A chart is applied which doesn't cause a change to the statefulSet.
* When waiting for the statefulset, this message appears:
```
StatefulSet is not ready: namespace-example/statefulset-example. 3 out of 0 expected pods have been scheduled
```

In the StatefulSet's status, the `currentRevision` matches the `updateRevision` and both the `currentReplicas` and `updatedReplicas` are set to `3`.

The related code here: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/662090a37e977922828779d249f9cc4f8fc7ed1d/pkg/kube/wait.go#L321-L331 also matches the behaviour

`expectedReplicas := replicas - partition` (equals 0)

and `int(sts.Status.UpdatedReplicas) != expectedReplicas` since `UpdatedReplicas` is 3.

Getting a StatefulSet in this state can happen when updating the partition attribute after a rolling update:

* Start with a STS partition: 3
* Deploy a change.
* Rolling update by setting partition 0.
* Set partition back to 3.

I'm not sure if this would catch other cases, but it seems like taking the revisions into account would work:

```
expectedReplicas := replicas
if (sts.Status.UpdateRevision != sts.Status.CurrentRevision) {
   expectedReplicas -= partition
}
```
